entry.title: Feeding Umpqua hosts Empty Bowls Dinner
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Feeding Umpqua, a program of the United Community Action Network, will have its Empty Bowls Project Dinner Fundraiser from 5:30-7:30 p.m. Monday at the Joyce Morgan Food Distribution Center on UCAN’s campus, just north of Roseburg.

entry.title: Myrtle Creek Elks golf tournament Saturday
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — The annual Elks Scholarship Golf Tournament is scheduled to take place Saturday, with a 9 a.m. shotgun start for the four-person scramble.

entry.title: Stuart Gray takes Roseburg Forest Product’s helm as president, CEO
entry.summary: Stuart Gray officially assumed the role of president and CEO of Roseburg Forest Products on Sunday.

entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Douglas County Museum Foundation is having a fundraising event with author Linda Jones Weber from 4-6 p.m. Saturday.

entry.title: ROSEBURG GETS OVER 4.5 INCHES LESS RAIN THAN NORMAL FOR THE RAIN YEAR
entry.summary: October 3, 2023 4:00 a.m. Roseburg received over 4.5 inches less rain than normal for the rain year which ended on Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that 27.51 inches of rain fell at the Roseburg Regional Airport between October 1st of 2022 and September 30th...

entry.title: STUART GRAY TAKES ROSEBURG’S HELM AS PRESIDENT AND CEO
entry.summary: October 3, 2023 3:50 a.m. In the KQEN Business Spotlight: Roseburg Forest Products has announced that Stuart Gray officially assumed the role of president and CEO on October 1st. Corporate Communications Director Rebecca Taylor said this finalizes a leadership transition first announced in July of this year. Grady Mulberry, who served as the company’s top...

entry.title: TENTATIVELY SCHEDULED PRESCRIBED PASTURE BURNS TO START THIS WEEK
entry.summary: October 3, 2023 3;40 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association has tentatively scheduled prescribed pasture burns start this week. Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said burning is scheduled to begin Tuesday at 1:00 p.m. near Goodrich Highway in the Metz Hill area. entry.summary: October 3, 2023 3;20 a.m. The Douglas County Human Trafficking Task Force, sponsored by Mercy Foundation, has been awarded a grant of just over $213,000 from the Oregon Department of Justice VOCA program to support the work of the task force. entry.title: 23RD ANNUAL PINK PREMIER TEA & FASHION SHOW IS SUNDAY
entry.summary: October 3, 2023 3:00 a.m. Douglas County Cancer Services is holding the 23rd annual Pink Premier Tea & Fashion Show this Sunday afternoon at Seven Feathers Casino & Resort. The fundraiser honors breast cancer survivors and includes brunch, a silent auction, a themed hat contest, door prizes and more. Local firefighters are helping with the...

entry.title: October is fire prevention month
entry.summary: OREGON — Each year, October is designated as Fire Prevention Month in Oregon, with four weeks dedicated to learning about fire safety. This year's theme for Fire Prevention Month is "Cooking Safety Starts with You. Pay Attention to Fire Prevention."
